content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata>  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Bill J. Bunker, Jack Gilmore, Bob Pyle, Joost Korpel</origin>     <pubdate>19950424</pubdate>     <title>Iowa Geologic Sampling Points</title>     <edition>20120322</edition>     <geoform Sync="TRUE">vector digital data</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>Iowa City, IA</pubplace>      <publish>Iowa Department of Natural Resources</publish>     </pubinfo>     <onlink>ftp://ftp.igsb.uiowa.edu/gis_library/ia_state/geologic/geologic_sampling_points.zip</onlink>     <ftname Sync="TRUE">geologic_sampling_points</ftname>     <origin>Iowa Department of Natural Resources</origin></citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>Point locations of geologic samples/files in the IGS repository.  Types  of samples include well cuttings, outcrop samples, cores, drillers logs, measured sections, hydrologic information, well construction, etc.</abstract>    <purpose>This digital, geographically referenced data set was developed by the Iowa Department of Natural Resources to carry out agency responsibilities related to management, protection, and development of Iowa's natural resources.</purpose>    <langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>20120322</caldate>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>edition date</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>Monthly</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc Sync="TRUE">-96.672443</westbc>     <eastbc Sync="TRUE">-90.097445</eastbc>     <northbc Sync="TRUE">43.555504</northbc>     <southbc Sync="TRUE">40.342434</southbc>    </bounding>    <lboundng>     <leftbc Sync="TRUE">203075.710000</leftbc>     <rightbc Sync="TRUE">734588.240000</rightbc>     <bottombc Sync="TRUE">4471632.730000</bottombc>     <topbc Sync="TRUE">4822505.608400</topbc>    </lboundng>   </spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt>     <themekey>Geoscientific Information</themekey>     <themekey>environment</themekey>    </theme>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>Wells</themekey>     <themekey>Geology</themekey>    </theme>    <place>     <placekey>Iowa</placekey>     <placekt>GNIS</placekt>    </place>   </keywords>   <accconst>none</accconst>   <useconst>The development of the coverages in the NRGIS Library represents a major investment of staff time and effort.  As a professional responsibility, the the Iowa DNR expects to receive proper credit when these GIS coverages are utilized. The Department also expects that the original documentation will remain with any redistribution of these coverages.</useconst>   <ptcontac>    <cntinfo>     <cntperp>      <cntper>Mary Howes</cntper>      <cntorg>Iowa Department of Natural Resources</cntorg>     </cntperp>     <cntpos>Research Geologist III</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>      <address>109 Trowbridge Hall</address>      <city>Iowa City</city>      <state>IA</state>      <postal>52242-1319</postal>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>319-335-1448</cntvoice>     <cntemail>mary.howes@dnr.iowa.gov</cntemail>    </cntinfo>   </ptcontac>   <native Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000</native>   <natvform Sync="TRUE">Shapefile</natvform>   <secinfo>    <secsys>State of Iowa Enterprise Data Classification Standard</secsys>    <secclass>public</secclass>   </secinfo>  </idinfo>  <dataqual>   <posacc>    <horizpa>     <horizpar>Precision of data points varies from five quarter sections to section centers.  Locations of older wells were generated by in house routines in the past, whereas newer points have been assigned utm (Nad83) and Latitude/Longitude values via GPS or in house programming routines and Esri ArcMap.</horizpar>    </horizpa>   </posacc>   <lineage>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <title>None</title>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>     <srcscale>None</srcscale>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>This dataset has been filtered to only sites that have xy coordinates and elevation within the GEOSAM dataset (SQL), from which an Event theme is generated and then exported to a point shapefile (Nad83 utm coordinate projection; Zone 15). Information contained within this dataset includes x & y coordinates (both in Nad83 utm and Latitude/Longitude), owner name at time of data entry, total depth of well or height of measured section, elevation of site where it can be determined from a variety of sources (e.g. 7.5' quadrangle), or utilizing the Surface Spot tool in ArcGis and interception of the 10 meter gridded elevation surface from the Dnr NrGisLib coverages; and numerous other site specific information.  The Geologic_Sampling_Points dataset is in a constant state of update as sites are being field located/re-evaulated and then corrected in the Geosam database.</procdesc>    </procstep>   </lineage>   <attracc>    <attraccr>None</attraccr>   </attracc>   <logic>None</logic>   <complete>None</complete>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>   <direct Sync="TRUE">Vector</direct>   <ptvctinf>    <sdtsterm Name="geologic_sampling_points">     <sdtstype Sync="TRUE">Entity point</sdtstype>     <ptvctcnt Sync="TRUE">69442</ptvctcnt>    </sdtsterm>    <esriterm Name="geologic_sampling_points">     <efeatyp Sync="TRUE">Simple</efeatyp>     <efeageom Sync="TRUE">Point</efeageom>     <esritopo Sync="TRUE">FALSE</esritopo>     <efeacnt Sync="TRUE">69442</efeacnt>     <spindex Sync="TRUE">TRUE</spindex>     <linrefer Sync="TRUE">FALSE</linrefer>    </esriterm>   </ptvctinf>  </spdoinfo>  <spref>   <horizsys>    <planar>     <planci>      <plance Sync="TRUE">coordinate pair</plance>      <coordrep>       <absres Sync="TRUE">0.000000</absres>       <ordres Sync="TRUE">0.000000</ordres>      </coordrep>      <plandu Sync="TRUE">meters</plandu>     </planci>     <gridsys><gridsysn Sync="TRUE">Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn><utm><utmzone Sync="TRUE">15</utmzone><transmer><sfctrmer Sync="TRUE">0.999600</sfctrmer><longcm Sync="TRUE">-93.000000</longcm><latprjo Sync="TRUE">0.000000</latprjo><feast Sync="TRUE">500000.000000</feast><fnorth Sync="TRUE">0.000000</fnorth></transmer></utm></gridsys></planar>    <geodetic>     <horizdn Sync="TRUE">North American Datum of 1983</horizdn>     <ellips Sync="TRUE">Geodetic Reference System 80</ellips>     <semiaxis Sync="TRUE">6378137.000000</semiaxis>     <denflat Sync="TRUE">298.257222</denflat>    </geodetic>    <cordsysn>     <geogcsn Sync="TRUE">GCS_North_American_1983</geogcsn>     <projcsn Sync="TRUE">NAD_1983_UTM_Zone_15N</projcsn>    </cordsysn>   </horizsys>   <vertdef>    <altsys>     <altres Sync="TRUE">0.000100</altres>     <altenc Sync="TRUE">Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates</altenc>    </altsys>   </vertdef>  </spref>  <eainfo>   <detailed Name="geologic_sampling_points">    <enttyp>     <enttypl Sync="TRUE">geologic_sampling_points</enttypl>     <enttypt Sync="TRUE">Feature Class</enttypt>     <enttypc Sync="TRUE">69442</enttypc>    </enttyp>    <attr>     <attrlabl Sync="TRUE">FID</attrlabl>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">FID</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">OID</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis>     <attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale>     <attrdef Sync="TRUE">Internal feature number.</attrdef>     <attrdefs Sync="TRUE">ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom Sync="TRUE">Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Shape</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>     </attrdomv>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">Shape</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Geometry</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">0</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis>     <attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Wnumber</attrlabl>     <attrdef>A unique six-digit ID number assigned by the Iowa Geological Survey to a geologic/hydrologic site for which information is on file.  This is a "site specific" identification number utilized by IGS/DNR.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">WNUMBER</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Integer</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">9</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">9</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Name_owner</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The name of the well or site.  This could be the owner, tenant, company, town, etc.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">Name_owner</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>St_cnty</attrlabl>     <attrdef>County Name within Iowa</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">St_cnty</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Twp</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the township number.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">TWP</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>N_S</attrlabl>     <attrdef>"N" or "S" township designation (in Iowa they are all "N")</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">N_S</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">1</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Rge</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the range number.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">RGE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>E_W</attrlabl>     <attrdef>an "E" or "W" designating the range as East or West of the 5th Prime Meridian.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">E_W</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Sec</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the section number of the site.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">SEC</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Qqqqq</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the quarter-sections listed largest to smallest.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">QQQQQ</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Tot_depth</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the total drilled depth of a hole or the total vertical exposure below the datum.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">TOT_DEPTH</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Latitude</attrlabl>     <attrdef>a number denoting the latitude of the site in decimal degrees.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">LATITUDE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Longitude</attrlabl>     <attrdef>a number denoting the longitude of the site in decimal degrees.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">LONGITUDE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>LL_acc</attrlabl>     <attrdef>defines the accuracy of the latitude/longitude.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">LL_ACC</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Quad_coord</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the name of the 7+' quadrangle map the site is located upon.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">Quad_coord</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Elev</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the ground surface elevation in feet of the site above sea level.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">ELEV</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Position_</attrlabl>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">POSITION_</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Elev_acc</attrlabl>     <attrdef>defines the accuracy of the elevation and method used to obtain it.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">ELEV_ACC</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Other_id</attrlabl>     <attrdef>is a number and/or name that refines or extends the site's name_owner field.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">OTHER_ID</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">30</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Driller</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the well contractor or driller.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">DRILLER</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Drl_date</attrlabl>     <attrdef>is the date a well was originally completed.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">DRL_DATE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Date</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">8</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Br_depth</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the depth in feet to the bedrock surface from ground level. If bedrock is encountered at the surface or the site is an outcropping, "1" is entered as the bedrock depth.  If depth to bedrock is not reached or unknown "0" is entered as the value.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">BR_DEPTH</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Well_type</attrlabl>     <attrdef>describes the type of well in terms of it's "use" (e.g., private, municipal, etc.).</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">WELL_TYPE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Prod_data</attrlabl>     <attrdef>is a logical field indicating the presence of data that pertains to water levels and/or the production capability of the well.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">PROD_DATA</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Geologist</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the name of the geologist that logged the sample set or described the section.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">Geologist</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Stplg_date</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the date the log of the sample set or section was completed.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">STPLG_DATE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Date</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">8</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Geophy_log</attrlabl>     <attrdef>a logical field indicating the existence of geophysical logs.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">GEOPHY_LOG</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Aquifer</attrlabl>     <attrdef>refers to the aquifer(s) the well is producing from.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">AQUIFER</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">254</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Geo</attrlabl>     <attrdef>a logical field indicating that the record is also in the GEO database</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">GEO</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Drl_mthd</attrlabl>     <attrdef>denotes the type of drilling rig (rotary, cable, etc.) used to drill the hole.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">DRL_MTHD</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Utm_x</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the utm x coordinate.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">UTM_X</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Utm_y</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the utm y coordinate.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">UTM_Y</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Well_depth</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the most current reported depth of the well and is always less than or equal to tot_depth.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">WELL_DEPTH</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Fieldloc</attrlabl>     <attrdef>a logical field indicating that the site has been reliably field located.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">FIELDLOC</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Site_type</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the type of site (e.g., drilled hole, roadcut, etc.).</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">SITE_TYPE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Smpl_type</attrlabl>     <attrdef>denotes the type of sample(s) comprising the sample set.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">SMPL_TYPE</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Log_type1</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the most detailed type of sample log completed on the sample set or exposure</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">LOG_TYPE1</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Log_qual1</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the quality of log_type1.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">LOG_QUAL1</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>StoretId</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the unique identifier for Storet sampling sites.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">STORETID</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Integer</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">9</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">9</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Log_type2</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the 2nd most detailed type of sample log completed on the sample set or exposure.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">LOG_TYPE2</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Log_qual2</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the quality of log_type2.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">LOG_QUAL2</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Project</attrlabl>     <attrdef>indicates the project name for a group of wells or sites such as a series of test holes, a gas storage field, a monitoring site, etc.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">Project</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Operator</attrlabl>     <attrdef>indicates the name of a third party having interest in the well or site. The operator, in the case of gas storage fields, is drilling or mining on another's property through lease agreements.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">Operator</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>PwtsId</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the Private Well Tracking System number assigned.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">PWTSID</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Integer</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">9</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">9</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Scanned</attrlabl>     <attrdef>a logical field indicating that a scanned striplog is available.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">SCANNED</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>SdwisId</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the unique identifier for Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS) sites.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">SdwisId</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Number</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">9</attwidth>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Drl_log</attrlabl>     <attrdef>a logical field indicating that a pdf file of the drilling record is available for viewing via the Geosam website.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">DRL_LOG</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">SmallInteger</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">4</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>PwsId</attrlabl>     <attrdef>the Public Water Supply ID number assigned.</attrdef>     <attalias Sync="TRUE">PWSID</attalias>     <attrtype Sync="TRUE">Integer</attrtype>     <attwidth Sync="TRUE">9</attwidth>     <atprecis Sync="TRUE">9</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Usgs_Id</attrlabl>     <attrdef>is the unique identifier assigned by the U.S. Geological Survey</attrdef>     <attalias
